summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and attorney Gary Stein, with Elizabeth Sullivan copied. The discussion concerns a follow-up investigation into whether the Professional Children's School (PCS) has records from 1997-2000 related to third-party payments, donations, or scholarships connected to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate a call to discuss the matter.

persons.name: Gary Stein
persons.role: Partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP
persons.context: Attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office regarding a subpoena and records request related to Jeffrey Epstein's potential financial transactions with the Professional Children's School.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Federal prosecutor leading the inquiry, asking Gary Stein about the availability of records from the Professional Children's School related to third-party payments connected to Jeffrey Epstein from 1997 to 2000.

persons.name: Elizabeth Sullivan
persons.role: Attorney at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence between Gary Stein and the U.S. Attorney's office regarding the Epstein-related records request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier and convicted sex offender whose potential financial transactions with the Professional Children's School, such as tuition payments or sponsored scholarships, are being investigated by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Scheduled call regarding Epstein records
events.description: A call was scheduled for Thursday morning (April 8, 2021) between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and attorney Gary Stein to discuss records from the Professional Children's School related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prior voicemail and inquiry about tuition payments
events.description: Reference to a prior voicemail from Gary Stein to the U.S. Attorney's office checking on the possibility of records relating to tuition payments connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 919 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022 (Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP office)
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's potential financial ties to the Professional Children's School (PCS) as of April 2021.
The investigation sought records from 1997 to 2000 regarding third-party payments, donations, sponsored scholarships, or similar financial transactions connected to Epstein.
A prior subpoena had been issued for student financial records, and the prosecutor was inquiring if a new subpoena was needed for third-party payment records.
The correspondence indicates the school's records from that period may no longer have been available, which was a point of inquiry for the investigation.
